intro: Jacobinia monticola, commonly known as the mountain Jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Jacobinia monticola is often found in humid, high-altitude environments where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
